update.description:
There are some new naming rules in the sdformat 1.7 proposal related to reserved names and unique names for sibling elements:

* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#3-2-unique-names-for-all-sibling-elements
* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#3-3-reserved-names

This PR checks for reserved names when loading DOM objects and checks for sibling name uniqueness with `ign sdf --check`. It includes several sdf files and tests.

I've targeted pull request #589 directly, since it is independent of the other chain of pull requests changing the API for accessing and resolving poses, so this can be reviewed independently.
update.title: [Citadel] Enforce rules about reserved names and unique names among sibling elements

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Enforce rules about reserved names and unique names among sibling elements

content.raw: Made some changes so that the validators ignore `<plugin>` elements and namespaced elements. I've also added the changes needed for the [custom elements proposal](http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=custom_elements_attributes_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&).
content.html: Made some changes so that the validators ignore <plugin> elements and namespaced elements. I've also added the changes needed for the custom elements proposal.
